edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.Entity

  • public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents any entity within the game world.
    Author:
    Aidan Novobilski

    • Field Detail

      • position

        private int[] position
        This field represents the position of the entity in the game map. All movement functions and "check-nearby" functions will operate using the entity's position. Set during constructor,

      • isAlive

        private boolean isAlive
        This field represents whether or not the entity has been destroyed. While true, the entity will be allowed to perform any function as usual. If it is false, the game will more or less ignore the entity, and it will be prevented from interacting with the game. Set during constructor and,

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity()

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(UI.direction dir)
        This method will move the entity in the desired direction. It must be passed a direction from UI.direction. If either number in the position is less than 0 or greater than 9, the move will fail and the entity will remain stationary.
        Parameters:
        dir - The direction to move in.

      • getPosition

        public int[] getPosition()
        This method will return the current position of the entity.
        Returns:
        Returns the position

      • checkIfAlive

        public boolean checkIfAlive()
        This method will return whether the entity is currently alive.
        Returns:
        Returns true if alive, false if dead.

      • kill

        public void kill()
        This method will "kill" the object, effectively removing it from the game. This allows the game to ignore the entity after the point at which it has been "killed".
